Brown |location=Beachwood, Ohio, USA|publisher=[[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]] |year=2010| pages=ix-x}} is Miers Busch Professor and Professor of [[Statistics]] at the [[Wharton School]] of the [[University of Pennsylvania]] in [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]]. He was educated at the [[California Institute of Technology]] and [[Cornell University]], where he earned his Ph.D. in 1964. He has earned numerous honors, including election to the [[United States National Academy of Sciences]], and has published widely. He was president of the [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]] in 1992-93. He was elected to the [[American Academy of Arts and Sciences]] in 2013.[http://amacad.org/news/classlist2013.pdf Newly elected members], [[American Academy of Arts and Sciences]], April 2013, retrieved 2013-04-24.
